content: ZSORT is to reduce CPU time and elapsed time, it can require more storage than a DFSORT application that does not use ZSORT. The following restrictions disable ZSORT and revert to the use of traditional sorting technique:  SORTL facility is not enabled/unavailable on the processor  ZSORT is not enabled  OPTION COPY or SORT FIELDS=COPY is specified  Use of: – INREC – JOINKEYS – MERGE FIELDS – MODS(EXITS) statements – OUTREC – OUTFIL – SUM FIELDS  Program started sorts  Memory objects cannot be created Note: Not all sorts are eligible to use ZSORT. IBM’s zBNA tool provides modeling support for identifying potential ZSORT-eligible candidate jobs and estimates the benefits of ZSORT. The tool uses information in the SMF type 16 records. Chapter 3. Central processor complex design 89  Insufficient memory object storage available (required more than currently available)  Unsupported sort fields specified (examples Unicode, Locale, and ALTSEQ)  Unknown file size or file size=0. 
